titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Great White Fleet ephemera M1883

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-14T15:34-0700

did.unittitle: Great White Fleet ephemera

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Postcards, lithographs, clippings, and other material related to the Great White Fleet and the United States Navy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On December 16, 1907, the Great White Fleet of 16 battleships, 6 torpedo boats and 4 auxiliaries from the Atlantic fleet left Hampton Roads, Virginia for a round-the-world trip that would last over 2 years. President Teddy Roosevelt conceived of the idea of sending the fleet around the world as promotion for the United States in the wake of the Sino-Japanese war. Pictorial material including postcards, photographs, lithographs, magazine articles, a world map (map folder 3), flag (map folder 3), neptune certificate (map folder 2), sheet music (map folder 1), etc. The collection is based primarily on material from Mr. Edward Branning, electrician on the U.S.S. Rhode Island; other sources were later added.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Great White Fleet : ephemera (M1883). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: The three oversize items in map folders were cataloged individually but retain the M1883 number.

did.unittitle: 5 sheets from the Art Supplement to the Philadelphia Inquirer, dating June 19, April 24, July 2, June 19, 1898

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 sheets from the Art Supplement to the Philadelphia Inquirer, dating June 19, April 24, July 2, June 19, 1898. Colored photographic chromolithographs of the armored cruiser, New York, with inset portrait of Wm. T. Sampson; the USS battleship Kentucky; US protected cruiser San Francisco; US cruiser New Orleans; US armored cruiser Brooklyn, flagship.

did.unittitle: 24 Sub Post Card Co. views of the ships in the Great White Fleet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 24 Sub Post Card Co. black & white views of the ships in the Great White Fleet, published in Los Angeles. A letter written home covers the backs of 7 of them. This spectator of the fleet watched as it entered San Diego "sailing up from Mexico 16 abreast"... "Greatest parade I ever witnessed of 5000 sailors marching through the streets...".

did.unittitle: 4 real photo postcards of the USS Kearsarge, Arizona, cruiser Cincinnati & crew members.
9 color printed postcards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 9 color printed postcards, with postmarks of various ships of the fleet including Under Pepper Trees (SS South Dakota); Contact Mines ready to land; Torpedo Tube & Torpedo on US torpedo boat; US marines with rapid fire gun; Entrance to Naval Academy, Annapolis (USS Franklin); US Marine Barracks Annapolis MD (USS Kansas); Culibra Cut (USS Oregon); Coconut Palms, Hawaii (USS Colorado); view Franklyn Park Boston (USS Washington).

did.unittitle: 24 color postcards published by Edward Mitchell of San Francisco

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 24 color postcards published by Edward Mitchell of San Francisco of the ships of the fleet with details of their officer, length and batteries. Including USS Battleship "Connecticut", USS Battleship "Kearsarge", USS Battleship "Missouri"; USS Armored Cruiser "Pennsylvania"; USS armored Cruiser "California"; US Protected Cruiser "Charleston"; US Battleship "Minnesota" US Battleship "Georgia" (tipped in album); US armored cruiser "South Dakota"; US Battleship "Rhode Island"; US Battleship "Maine"; US Armored Cruiser "Washington"; US Armored Cruiser "Tennessee"; US Armored Cruiser "Charleston";US Battleship "Kentucky"; Crew of US Battleship "Rhode Island"; US Battleship "Virginia"; US Battleship "Missouri"; Battleship "Nebraska"; US Battleship "Maine"; US Battleship "Oregon"; US Battleship "Oregon" in dry dock; US Armored Cruiser "California"; US Battleship "New Jersey."

did.unittitle: 68 color photographs of ships
4 portraits of "Bob" Evans (commander of the fleet), each with a different verse of a poem.
Set of 9 Alan Fanjoy postcards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Set of 9 greeting postcards in an Art Nouveau design by Alan Fanjoy Publish Publishers, Ocean Park, CA including USS Ohio, Maine, Yanklan, Glacier, Rhode Island, Illinois, Virginia, Missouri, New Jersey.

did.unittitle: Clippings re: postmarks of Great White Fleet
Set of 6 Honey Boy cards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Romantic postcards involving a sailor and his girl.

did.unittitle: 7 postcards sent to Miss Jean Pray of Long Island

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of 7 postcards sent to Miss Jean Pray of Long Island, 1908-09, showing views of ports visited including Jumbo Tree in Santa Cruz, California with fold-out of fleet; Landing San Diego April 11,1898; Punta Arenas; Honolulu 1908; Admiral Sperry, Yokohama Japan; Landing on Domain after parade Sydney (Australia); real photo view of deck off Manila ("bad storm, lost a shipmate").

did.unittitle: 2 California Cards, 1 folding, welcoming the fleet in 1908
5 stereoscopic views of the Fleet
Unused calendar, each month commemorating a ship of the Fleet, issued by the Holyoke Mutual Fire Insurance Co.
2 complementary ball invitations
3 real photos, 1 of the Bennington sunk, by Bailey, and 2 on board the Wyoming
Hat band of the USS Wyoming
3 color photo lithographs of ships including the Columbia, the Oregon's race of Cuba, and the Battleship Alabama
Los Angeles City Public School certificate of donation to help replace the "Maine", destroyed in Havana in 1898
Triple fold postcard, the Atlantic Fleet's departure by artist Nick F. Quirk
12 offcuts of illustrated magazine articles about the Fleet
Autograph of W.F. Ichley, Rear Admiral USA
Miscellaneous
Life with the American Squadron : musical score by Harry V. Ingham (sheet music)
Neptune certificate given to Edward Branning to commemorate the crossing of the equator by the U.S.S. Rhode Island
World map
